intro: Diplazium chimborazense, commonly known as the Chimborazo spleenwort, is a fern native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually narrow and closely spaced, with a distinctive venation pattern. Diplazium chimborazense is an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
